intro: Dalechampia stipulacea var. minor, commonly known as the lesser stipulate dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, clustered inflorescences that produce yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
